review: This is your standard Chili's chain. If you know what to ordee, this is a great place to have a casual dinner. I've got many fond memories of Chili's - drove my girlfriend to a rooftop restaurant on our first Valentines in 2 hour traffic only to find out it has a fixed $200 seafood menu, which she hates. Where did we go instead? F*** it, let's just go to Chili's. Best Valentine's dinner ever.  There's only one thing you have to try here - Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers. Delicious sticky sauce, quality french fries with ranch and buttery soft corn on the cob. Screw the rest of the menu. 1500 calories of goodness.

First warning avoid the chicken I got salmonella  poisoning. It is one of the worst pains I have ever felt. Called to speak to a manger the next day manager actually tried to tell me it was my fault for not returning the food.  Sorry, however it's your staffs fault. Chicken is one of the top foods you do NOT mess up.  Lunch time at this chili's seems fine. The low crowds probably help them cook everything. Most of the problems seem to happen during dinner service. Drinks are not prepared properly. Food is obviously not.  My advice go to another chili's. Or another restaurant in Monrovia.

I am a creature of habit so my default order every time I come to Chili's seems to be chips and salsa and the 3-item Ultimate smokehouse combo set.  I love how thin and crispy their chips are, as I'm not a fan of those heavy thick deep fried chips that some other places serve. I usually go for the salsa accompaniment, but sometimes, if there's a Chili's deal going on, the queso is pretty good too. The smokehouse combo comes with roasted street corn, fries, garlic toast & pickles. For the meat, you can choose from chicken crispers, smoked sausage, BBQ chicken breast, or ribs. I've tried them all and enjoy the ribs and chicken crispers the best. I usually find chicken breast dry so I normally prefer to have dark meat over white. The smoked sausage is delicious, especially the first bite, but eating the whole thing gets overwhelming (too much flavor and too heavy at the end), which makes it drop down the list after ribs and crispers. 90% of the time, I only get as far as ordering the chips and salsa and the smokehouse set and then call it quits with leftovers to take home. The other 10%, I'll still order the same and have leftovers, but add in a dessert of the molten lava cake. Oooh, don't forget to sign up for their Rewards Program (coordinated with Plenti), which allows you to rack up points and offers various discounts and offers.

location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Great service, good food,  and great ambiance. This is for the bar side.  Shout out to Raquel, our bartender, she makes some pretty AWESOME margaritas. She was pretty vigil about asking if we needed anything or if we were good.  The food came out quick. I love, love their enchilada soup and their chips are really good too. What's great about the bar area is that she actually put 4 different football games on.  Most places you walk in and there's only one or two games in several tvs. Plenty of parking and you can order to go.  The restaurant is clean and so were the bathrooms.  Hope to come back for dinner.  Although,  I really like the bar area.  Great spot to hang out with friends on Sunday to watch the games.

Love Chili's, not sure why the low reviews. It's chili's, I guess you should know what you're getting into unless the service totally stinks. The thing I always get here are the Chicken Crispers.  The heart attack on a platter as one waitress said to me many years ago.  I never really order anything else as my main entree as this is my favorite item on the whole menu.  Sure, I've tried the fajitas, burgers and even the ribs. I mean, who can forget their infamous song.. "I want my baby back, baby back, baby back..." Still after all that, it's all about the original chicken crispers. The other main reason why I come here is because they have one of my all time favorite desserts, the fricken chocolate molten cake. Omg this thing is to die for. Perfectly cooked chocolate cake with warm hot fudge oozing in the middle. Crowned with vanilla ice cream and chocolate fudge over that.  .tasty. Food came out tally fast, but he service was a little lackluster. Once the food came, we didn't see our waitress for awhile, a good 15-20 minutes after. We had to flag down some rando to ask for more napkins, water refill, etc. Forgot to take pictures as we were busy watching Justine Turner hit a walk off to beat the Cubs in game 2 of the NLCS.
They have good appetizers, menu can use some work, but overall this place is decent, Im not raving about it, but cant complain either.

Excellent service from our waiter Joey this evening. He was friendly, professional and very attentive the entire time. Great job I liked the updated menu and kids menu too (good new and some healthy options for the kiddos).  Extra $2 charge for dry rub? Ok Beware, there is a $1.99 "table entertainment" fee that I was unaware of for some games that my kid was playing on the table kiosk thing. Anyway, there is no parental  warning or approval request.  $5 Thurs Margarita (President)..was good!

Ever since Applebee's closed down in this area, my family didn't really have a go-to sit-in chain restaurants type of thing that still had fairly cheap food. So, we decided to opt for Chili's and this was probably one of the worst decisions ever.  At our first visit, the place was pretty packed, so we understood why there was slow service and what-not. However, they made up for it by offering us free chips and salsa which was pretty cool. So, our first time visit went fairly well. Thus, we decided to go for our second time and this just wasn't ideal at all.  On this visit, the service was extremely slow as there simply wasn't enough workers. There wasn't a long line and I would assume that there were a few dabbles of people here and there. However, we had to wait a long time to the point where it just became frustrating. We had to wait approximately twenty minutes to order our food. On top of that wait, we had to wait another hour to have our food come out. Honestly, it just wasn't worth it.  Parking-  There is plenty of parking as this is in a huge plaza. However, finding a parking spot close to the restaurant might become a bit iffy as there are a lot of restaurants nearby.  Food-  Honestly, this kind of made up for the wait time. However, it was either too salty or too bland. (we ordered the bbq trio or something like that)  Service-  One of the worst service I've had before. My parents and I had arrived fairly earlier than families of our same size. However, they were seated before us, which my mom wasn't too pleased about.  In general, come here if you're super hungry and somehow the chipotle or the panera nearby don't suit your taste or come here if you would like to waste time.

Love this Chili's!! Reina is the BEST server ever!! We always come here and request her. Always very friendly, attentive and just plain on it! She's awesome. Will be coming back and continuing to ask for her. Thanks Chili's for having awesome people working there. Love this place!!!

My boyfriend and I came here last night. It was pretty full, but we opted to sit at the bar section. They have regular booths there too as well fasted service. I hold highly recommend this chili's! We had the fajita plate and bbq rib combo meal. If you are in the are shopping, take the time to check it out!

In general I'm a big fan of Chili's. We love the honey Chipotle boneless wings. I've got to hand it to them I really like the shrimp fajitas here. But when we came the other day I ordered it to go.  we ordered quite a few things which were all yummy but I will say the barbecue chicken breast was very undercooked. So much so that it was very difficult to pull apart. I had to throw it out. This is definitely an isolated incident most likely because I don't normally have issues with the food that I get here. All in all, a good spot.

I liked the ribs here, especially the dry rubbed ribs. Unfortunately, the bartender was also our server so service was very slow. Slow to the point that I believe he actually forgot about us. I'd go back for the ribs and mashed potatoes but not sit anywhere close to the bar area.
Great Atmosphere, friendly waitress & staff, food & service is great!!  Honey Chipotle crispers and waffles were AMAZING!!!! Steak & Shrimp Fajitas were Delicious.

I've only dine at Chili's twice, and sorry to say that I probably won't be back. They have totally taken ordering and paying to an impersonal level. You literally order and pay via tablet. In between service from our server wasn't spectacular or attentive.  When paying for our meal, they don't let you use more than one form of payment. We paid with a gift card and wanted to pay the balance and tip with another credit card. If our server didn't ask us how we were doing he would have been shorted on his table and tips.  The food choices weren't great and we didn't want to take the rest home.

You know, I really appreciate the fact that the food here has improved over the last few years, but they change their menu too often. Several times that I've found myself hooked on an entree, and I return to find it's been removed from their menu.  The place is clean about 60% of the time, and that  is also really annoying, but I keep coming back!

Been coming here few times now and have had bad service on back to back visits both times had to speak with manager KYLE.who will come and apologize and than go hide in the kitchen.sad to say i will take my business down the road to red lobster.thats about 80 to 90 bucks a month X12 months around $1000 bucks chilis will lose .they just dont care about service here what so ever.  P.s. Yelp should give you an option to check the - negative star box cause thats what they deserve

Dylan is the BEST Server ! So ask for him !!  Sadly this time when I came with my family, they seated us in the back right corner near the kitchen. I understand it was busy but I wasn't very happy that we were seated there because we were surrounded by employees, we could over hear their drama very clear and they were yelling out orders and etc.. Personally I don't think that's a very good area to be seated at.

It's Sunday, 6:00 pm with tables available and the host says it'll be a 10 to 15 minute wait, reason short staff, NOT GOOD. This Chili's does not care about its patrons as they have done this multiple times.  I'll go to a better Chili's in West Covina next time (even though this one is closer to home. Now let's see what happens when we get seated.

I hate coming to this Chili's they have horrible service, it was super dirty. We waited in the lobby for a good 10 min until I had to get one of the waitresses to be seated and she seemed annoyed having to help us.

I came to watch the superbowl and when  the Patriots made a play I got excited and the manager came up to me and said be quite so I was but then the other team got a play in everyone was yelling and he didn't say nothing  Kevin McCafferty was so rude and also called me out and was saying I no nothing about football witch is not the point ur a manager u should take care of ur customers not treat them like bad baggage I would recommend they change the manager for sure

Absolutely love this Chilis! First of all I wast greeted by a friendly smile when we walked in! We were seated and our waitress was very attentive as wall all the staff! Food was good as usual and cocktails were excellent!!

I have not been here in a few years and today was a perfect example of why I avoid this place. Service was mediocre, could not tell you our server's name who was so lifeless. We asked for a glass of water which taste like the remanence of melted ice only to lead us to order $3 water bottle because they cannot provide patrients with a clean glass of water. Food was surprisingly delicious but our overall experience was not positive.

This review is a day late, but a group of 7 and I went to this location yesterday around 9:15ish and the service yesterday was amazing! The wait was decent and our server Jake was incredible! Will definitely be back!

Came here for dinner. Made reservations for a large group. Received a table quickly. Server was having a rough day. She told us she had been here all day and was tired. Would not divide our check up for us. Took orders for drinks for half the table and not the other and told us we were talking too much so she left. She brought out the food in a timely manner everything was hot the food was good. Never asked us for dessert. Was not very friendly to us. We asked for dessert but she said sorry. Restrooms were terrible! Water on the floor, toilet paper on the floor they don't look like they had been cleaned for a while. Will not come back to this restaurant.

I came in 8pm Saturday night and this place is a Joke. Needs to stock more employees.1hr wait with 9 free tables but the servers say you can't sit down because they don't have anyone to server you. The manager says they don't expect this kind of volume on a Saturday night.... someone needs to step up and stock a few more servers.

We were a party of two. Both orders were made wrong. First order took at least 15 minutes to remake and it was just a plain burger. Second order was also a burger but didn't get it with grilled onions as ordered. Server offered to bring some but I didn't want to have to wait another 15 minutes and have my burger get cold during the wait.

My family and I enjoy eating at Chili's and frequently visit the Diamond Bar location, since it's closest to us.  My boyfriend and I stopped by the Monrovia location since we were in Arcadia and this location is so awful compared to the one we frequent. Dirty plates, messy servings, and different from what we're used to at the DB location. Servers come off as tired, exhausted, and unenthusiastic. Our server was friendly, she checked up on us but the others were mediocre when we asked for help. The panko onions rings were messy and had crumbs all over the plate, like someone just threw it on quickly. Along with that, the portion was a noticeably smaller portion than what we're served at our usual location. The plate had food crumbs on it and the chicken pasta was dry and sauce-less; again, very different from what we get. Strawberry lemonade was watered down to a light pink color while it is usually a darker pink color. Iced tea was very syrup-y and fake. The booth seat was broken and kept wobbling whenever I moved. My family and I are frequent customers and were familiar with how things usually are. I think we'll just stick to the usual location we go to. We love Chili's but this location needs to step up their management and cleanliness!
Fuck this place shit lags took an hour to get my food applebees be better than this so get your Pokémon go ready Bc you'll be waiting for a while

My wife called a day ahead to order some take out that I would pick up this afternoon. I arrived at 3:30 and found a sign on the counter where take out food used to be picked up. The sign said "See the bartender for take out food." I went to the bar and there wasn't a bartender present. I had to find a waitress and ask for the bartender. My order wasn't ready - it was as if I had just ordered the food when I arrived. They didn't appear to be busy. No bueno. I think Chilis is going down hill.

I visited here one week ago.Very disorganized restaurant.Hostess didn't know what she was doing.Food was cold and no taste.At the end I asked for check and we waited and waited an waited.Then I had to get somebody else to get our check.Overall very disappointed.

I dont know if they changed mangers/cooks or what... but business is not the same. after many times getting bad service and food i say never again! but i go back hoping it would have turned around... but no still the same. no host to host you when you walk in. whats the point of having the koisk if the waiters dont notice you need a refill or order dessert. They have the habit of bring out the food rather late... 30 min-45 min. Rather go to West cOvina, which is not in my area, but i will drive out there knowing i will have good hot meal

I came in for a late night dinner and sat in the bar area , Adam was my server again& gave great service just like last time . He's friendly and knows how to do his job. I ordered the honey chipotle shrimp and sirloin , I thought it was really good. My boyfriend got the steak and shrimp fajitas...he wasn't crazy about them he thought it was a little salty but either way everything was good . He tried the tropical sunrise margarita and loved it , I think I'll continue to like this place and come back here when he's our server because the other servers or hostesses I've came across haven't gave the same type of service .

Came here today work my two boys.   They like to play on the ipad that is on every table and I come for the burgers.   Great burger for the price and not to busy right now at this time.   It will get more busy as the night goes on though.
My favorite place for happy hour and 2 for $20 the carnitas  are the bomb and enough food for two margaritas  are the best.

Guess I'm done for good with Chili's. The food is okay but what this chain seems to have forgotten is there's more to dining out than the food. It's the EXPERIENCE they've screwed us over on. ZERO customer service. Over 10 minutes to be greeted can be forgiven if the server actually had a personality. Now they just drop food off on your table and they're gone for good. Pay on a machine and that's the end of your night. Really sad that this is what it's come down to-- back in the day this was a pretty cool place to come to. Bye bye Chili's.

To make it short, the palace is sad. I went there with my GF and everything seemed very unorganized. We ordered our food and the food was over cooked. The cheese they put on the fries looked old and was very plain. I'll never go back

Got a call from the store manager after I had complained to Chili's corporate and the LA Health Department about being food poisoned.  Instead of apologizing and/or offering a refund, he asked me if my boyfriend and I had eaten anything else that day, like Cliff bars, since they had a recent food recall.  (We had NOT eaten Cliff bars that day, and not even in the past year, so that was way out of left field.)  He did send some gift certificates, but I did not appreciate him alleging we did not get sick from his restaurant. He then asked me all these other alternative questions to try and figure out how he could prove I did NOT get sick from burgers I ate at his restaurant.  Is he all of a sudden a nutritionist giving me advice???   As you can see from all the other terrible reviews, this place honestly just sucks.
Avoid this place. Get your shit together and change up your kitchen staff. Food is horrible. and place is understaffed.

If I could give a zero AGAIN, I would They just can't get it together!!! Just got here empty tables everywhere!!!! Hostess says 20-30 minute wait cuz party of 5 is a large party??? At 8:30 at night? She is either full of it, maybe she doesn't want to work? Not trained? The bar is empty with people and tables, the floor is only 20% full..... I then proceed to look around at all the empty tables look back at the untrained hostess says she has a party of 8 and 6 ahead of us? Really?? If she has that many parties ahead of us why is she not setting up any of the empty tables? If they are so slammed where is her manager? Off to Olive Garden down the street, only 10 minute wait and employees are actually working, friendly and trained...Chilis Monrovia needs to Be fixed again!  Managers need to be on the floor and employees need training!

Question: Why is one stressed out waitress serving a team of 26 people, and more tables on top of that? She shouldn't have to jog around the restaurant all night to do her job. Hire some more servers. You seem in desperate need. Update: 60 minutes later, and we've got sodas.

Ok guys, so I hear they've changed the recipe for the mashed potatoes , so that was a bit of a shocker but let me tell you that this location has the best waitress (I forgot her name but she's really pretty with flawless makeup) an the best manager Kevin!!! Quick service , clean , and good music , yeah you'd be surprised but some chillies have stripper music (Inglewood location, just saying ) , will def be back !!! Love the 2 for 22 menu!!
Had a real nice time. Sat us quick, service was great. Food good. This was the first time at this location. I was satisfied over all!!
Food was good, service was good I'll be back..... it has definitely improved since the last time I was there so I'll give it another chance
Worst service here waiters are so rude and made our party feel so uncomfortable. Never coming here again! I rather drive the extra 30 mins for good service  Wish I could give no stars!

Pink or no Pink that is the new way Chilis makes there burgers.. No medium well.. The Manager and the Server very Rude. Don't come here!! The Manager is the cook and the head honcho.  We brought our daughter for lunch with the family and just complete messed up our lunch.  Not coming here again!!!  Don't get there Smash Burger or burgers! I should of just went with the fajitas.  We order dr. Pepper and brought him Diet Coke with his smash burger pink inside he had to kick it back twice with no expectation.  Don't come here at lunch!!

Don't know what the deal is. I went to three Chilis in the last two months. I ordered the same exact thing at three different locations. All three forgot to give me the chips. I first thought it could be the waiter. After three places with the same problem, this got to be bad business practice. The three are Monrovia, San Diego near Sorrento and West Covina. Same order. The two for $22 meals with a salsa and chips selected.  I have to check the order at the order each time. So be sure to check your take-out orders.

The worst experience I've ever had!!!!!  Waiter very confused and couldn't remember what our table ordered for the life of him. Food was cold and NASTY! It was crowded and loud. Beer was flat! My list goes on STAY AWAY if your looking for a good experience. I usually don't like leaving bad reviews but I must warn people about this place.

We love Chili's but this was the worst Chili's experience ever. We waited 25 minutes for seats and 45 minutes for our food. When the food finally arrived, the ribs were cold and the beef fajita was burnt. There was a spider on our table and trash beneath our dining table. We will not dine at this location again. The management needs to hire additional personnel.

Used yelp for reservation.we got here with no table available.we asked the host how long is the waiting. She said " I don't know". How would you not know the waiting time!.We left and have dinner at Claim Jumper..We are not going back to this restaurant...

We hadn't been to Chili's in several years after having had too many poor experiences.  Figured it had been a while and hopefully they had their act together a bit better now.  Sadly, we ended up with two even worse experiences.   For the first one we decided to place a to go order.  Two of us stood at the to go counter for almost 15 minutes.  The to go counter is right next to the door to the kitchen, so it isn't as if no one knew we were there.  Finally, one of us asked a passing employer if we could please place an order.  "Just a minute, I'll get someone for you, " took another 5+ minutes.  He had some trouble taking our order, but when he repeated back to us, at our request, the order was correct.  We were told about 20 minutes,  so we ran over to one of the stores in the same mall.   We came back at 25 minutes and were told to pick up our food at the bar.   We checked in with the bartender and she said our food wasn't ready yet.   We asked her how much longer and she said that she'd go check.   The guy next to us wished us luck,  and said he'd been waiting almost 45 minutes.   Sure enough,  the bartender came back and told us it would be about another 15 minutes.   The guy next to us got his food before we did,  and was furious by the time he left.   A few minutes later we got our food,  but one meal was missing.  Glad we checked before we left!!  The bartender said she would get the order in on a rush.  Rush?  Yeah,  right!  The manager came by 15 minutes later to apologize and explained that the order had never been entered.   We explained to him that the server who took our order read everything back to us correctly.   He had no believable explanation.   We asked how much longer,  as this whole time the rest of our food is sitting here on the bar in front of us.   BTW.... the bartender said that it was okay for the teenager with us to sit at the bar itself!  When those of is who are over 21 told her that that's very much against the law,  she just laughed and told us to relax.   WTH?  Whatever,  it isn't our liquor license on the line.   It was another 15 minutes before we got our missing food.   Again,  yeah,  big rush!  The manager was smart enough not to ask is to pay for this missing item that took over half an hour to get.   Sure enough everything but the missing item was STONE COLD by the time we got home.    A small group of us made the mistake of going back a couple weeks later to eat there at the restaurant.   It took the sever 15 minutes to even get to the table.   When he did he SAT DOWN AT THE TABLE WITH US!!!!  Two of have been servers and we were both appalled at the gaul, ego,  rudeness and unprofessionalism of this guy.   Let's just say that the rest of the visit went along these same lines.   When we were told to pay at the kiosk on the table,  that was the last straw as far as his tip was concerned!  No chance any of us in either of these two groups will be back!!

The table was dirty when we were seated, the drinks were watered down, our spinach queso dip was clearly microwaved, and to top it off I got ill afterwards. This place has really gone down in quality and this past visit will be my last visit.

Worst service I've had. It took 25 min to get two drinks from the bar. All of the tables were messy and had previous customers plates on them for the 45 minutes we were here and they were there before we got there as well. The food was wrong and the manager was no where to be found when there was an issue. This place sucks!

The service was lacking on so many levels. My girlfriend asked for no mayo. The burger was smothered in 1000 island. He said they don't have any burger with mayo. We educated him about the ingredients of 1000 island dressing. It took FOREVER to get our order taken because the server didn't know how to listen not to mention he didn't understand the ingredients on the dishes so therefore was not capable of answering the questions asked. Not to mention he just flat out didn't listen. I asked him to omit the glaze because I don't eat sugar. He then went to the kitchen or I assumed that was what he did. I then see him walk back out after 10 minuets and take another tables order! He then came back and tried to educate me that all glaze has sugar. I said no kidding that's why I told you to omit the glaze and educated him as to what omit means as it was apparent he didn't have a comprehension of the words definition. He never refilled our drinks! It was so cold in there that I had to walk outside to warm up. In summation, I froze my tits off while waiting 40 minutes to even put an order in. Had to deal with a server who just showed up to collect his paycheck and could care less about whether or not he is proficient in his job. I can't say I would ever consider coming back. Basically an overly priced Denny's.
Great prices. Good food and this visit we had a wonderful server. She was on it. Never needed to ask for refill and she was a very friendly person. Can't wait to go back.

Ordered 2 for $35 appetizer guac and chips. Out comes chips.and salsa with the explanation we are only waiting on guac. Fast forward 20 mins guac comes out. Entree bacon burger well done. Burger comes out bloody as hell still mooing. Second try burger comes out medium. Open burger and guy who brought it admits it's medium. Fast forward to manager. "If you wanted a well done burger you should have asked in the beginning." I state "I did both times." Fast forward to dessert to eat there. Comes boxed with my meal not even a plastic fork to eat it in the parking lot. What a dissapointment. Be a long time before I roll here. And the food they sent. Straight in the trash cuz you know they spit in that shit. How bad I wanted to make a scene youll never know. And these ppl want 15 an hour. SMFH first time I've sent food back in 10 years what a disgrace
We came here for dinner. The food is good and the service was okay. It not busy at all. We always like to come here. Maybe it is because not crowded.

I ordered a medium rare steak and I got a rare steak. Had to send it back. So far all I've gotten is a good beer and very friendly server.  Second time around I got a burnt steak on the outside still rare inside.  Not a good experience!!

Let's start with the service - the best thing here according to my experience. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. The food and drinks were served on time.  DRINKS - decent. We had the Long Island ice tea. A bit too sweet for my taste but not bad.  FOOD - one word. Overpriced. For the appetizer we had the White Spinach Queso. It was a decent portion. Tasted ok. For dinner we had the salmon and baby back ribs from the Make It a Combo special.  Nothing great.  We didn't even use the little game pad for kids at the table, just scrolled through it to see what games they had. We got charged a fee for that. As you can see from the photo we got charged a total of $47 for less than mediocre food. I personally think Applebee's offers more choices and better food for the same price. Was not impressed with Chili's and will not be back.

Had an 805 that was clean and crisp. Chicken Crispers or well-done corn was sweet and buttery. My wife's Burger was cooked well but the egg on top for an additional charge what's not running like a sunny side up egg should be. Restaurant was moderately busy, but we were seated quickly on a Tuesday night.

This is where food goes to die.  It's horrible.  They can't even get a burger or fajitas right, and that only takes some salt, pepper, and garlic powder to be decent.  Do not waste your money.  And for those of you who can't eat gluten, these guys don't have corn tortilla chips!  Only flour tortilla chips!  At a Tex Mex!

Waited 30 min in bar to be seated, party of 5. Had an apparently 'craft' beer that was not on the all day Sunday happy hour.. super premium draft doesn't include craft beer FYI. Once seated, took 10 min for the others in our party to get their beer and no one ever showed up to take the food order. We asked another waiter after 30 min, now having been there over an hour without even ordering food, if someone could take our order.. another 5min passed and a guy with neck tattoos who looks like he hadn't showered in days shows up and says there was a 'boo-boo' as far as our waiter and took the order. We left the rest of our party there to deal with what will probably end up in cold food and went to eat elsewhere.

Yes, I'm the picky one.  When I order a hamburger well done I don't want any pink.  I can't tell you how many hamburgers I've sent back...even in special hamburger places like Shake Shack, the Counter and so on.  I was delighted with my burger , the price, and the servers, Emily and Morgan. No extra charge for bar b q sauce, ranch dressing or pickles. AND they remembered to keep the salt off my fries.  Good job Chilis!

Today my family went in for a good bye dinner. I'd have to say that the quality of their food has gone downhill. The Margarita chicken especially, that was my favorite plate until now. The chicken was extremely salty but the messy beans and spoon full of rice was enough to dilute it; it used to be flavorful and colorful. My sister ordered the enchilada soup, also salty and the waitress stated that it was on the salty side. No entre should ever be to salty and their chefs should know better. My husband mentioned his favorite plate used to offer a variety of sides that he didn't get this time around. Ultimately it comes down to the display of all their entrees and the taste and quality of the food as any other restaurant. They should look appetizing and appealing; only the salads look amazing these days. This was a place I came to enjoy, I'm a little disappointed.

Each time I come back to this Chili's I'm reminded why I stopped coming here in the first place. It's a busy location but what's frustrating for me is the disorganized and inconsistent service. Stopped for dinner on a Saturday evening. It wasn't crazy busy but it was busy. Service was ok and the food was a fail. Quesadilla was cold and hardly any cheese! The rest of our food was cold. The food was better in the past. Probably won't go back!

Wanted to try someplace we hadn't been in a while.  We started off at another restaurant - but it was over an hour wait.  Sooo, we moved over to Chili's - that had just a half-hour wait. No problem.  It's a weekend night and it's SoCal...you're going to have to wait at some point. Ordered drinks at the bar while waiting for a table...only to find that WHEN your table comes up they have no way of transferring your bar-tab to your table (such a system exists - I've seen it work). This breaks up our party into couples that are now scattered-about, trying to find and follow our hostess and our table while other servers are running all about with trays of food up and down the aisles. Okay, so we're at our table, our server is nice and attentive, we order, we get our food - and the cola is mixed to the point where it's mainly just soda-water & coloring. Nasty.   Burger joints and restaurants make QUITE a bit of mark-up on soda - so when I come across someplace that tweaks the mix even further, it's usually a sign of bad management - or just plain greed (it literally costs just pennies per serving for the establishment for the syrup.  They then recoup that cost by charging $2-2.50 per serving - and don't forget: the ice helps disburse the image of that serving). Unfortunately, one of our steaks - that had been ordered at medium-rare - came out all brown (Brown is NOT M-rare), so we had to send it back.  Took forever to get it replaced.   As another yelper pointed out - the payment system has now been changed so that after seating you, taking your order and serving it - your server (their employee), no longer has to deal with you.  S/he can be dealing with an entirely different group of people.   Meanwhile, I had to get up and find replacement flatwear (for the missing ones taken with the over-cooked steak), and napkins for our party (we had been given none). Later, we weren't even offered dessert - or a dessert menu to consider. (maybe management decided that was getting in the way of table turn-around per-hour - who knows?) You now pay via a wireless tablet with a built-in printer.  Swipe your card, choose what percentage of tip you wish to leave, sign, and your receipt is printed out immediately. No more human-interaction needed.  In essence; "Thanks, now SHOO - we need this table for other paying customers".  (yet they didn't pony-up for the system what allows your bar-tab to follow you to your table). Overall, the experience was NOT what helped make Chili's a cool, go-to place it was in it's early days.  AND, the food wasn't really that good in the first place.  Just, bland. Next time, we have decided to skip Chili's when people are visiting. As we commented about the place on our way home, i mentioned that - in MY mind - Chili's has definitely jumped-the-cuisine-shark...and in doing so, has actually ELEVATED Sizzler to a much more respectable restaurant. (Disclosure: once worked for Sizzler - and still love their salad bar).

Guess where Kyle was standing when I left? Right, in the corner!! I will NEVER frequent this Chili's again especially after reading all the comments on YELP. I really love this place I use to go here like once a week it very reasonable price really great costumer service I enjoyed the male manager he was fun and offered great costumer service

I haven't been here in years! So, it was nice to be back and see the menu changes that they've had since I've been here.  FOOD/DRINKS - 3 Stars: We ordered the $35 meal which included an appetizer (half order depending what it is), two entrees, and one dessert plus two margarita drinks. Texas Cheese Fries: This was pretty good. It was thick cut fries, cheese, bacon, and some ranch. There was a ton of cheese which I loved. I'll say that the half order was good enough for us. Anything more would've been way to heavy. Bacon Cheeseburger: This was a bacon cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, and onions. This was juicy, but it was a bit bland. I enjoyed it for the fact I was craving a burger, but that was pretty much it. Sadly, I've had better. It also came with a side of fries that I changed to loaded mashed potatoes. I was also excited for this, but it was alright. I kind of picked at it, but that was it. I'm a potato head, but I easily passed this over. Margarita Grilled Chicken: This was good. My friend liked the chicken and everything that came with it. I wish I enjoyed my meal as much as this was enjoyed. Cookie Skillet: This is a Pazookie wannabe. I had high hopes for it since I was actually craving a Pazookie, but this was a let down. I still ate it though, but the cookie wasn't as gooey as I hoped and it was actually sunken-in in the middle of it, which made it look a bit funny. The edge of the cookie was really overcooked so it was really cripsy versus the soft center. It came with some vanilla ice cream, which I took off. Presidente Margarita: I really liked mine because it had mango in it. I was surprised since I'm not a fan of the margarita taste, but this was good. SERVICE - 4 Stars: Our server was very attentive and awesome with taking our order even though we changed our mind at the very beginning. He was also helpful with us deciding what to order and his input was appreciated. ATMOSPHERE - 3 Stars: This place is noisy and busy with a lot of action. Aside from the kid constantly kicking the booth chair shared for two tables, everything was alright. There's also a bar area where people were watching the game so you'd hear shouts every so often. RECOMMENDATION: Well, I've had my Chili's fix for a couple of years or more. I don't think that I'd necessarily have the craving or desire to go back unless I had to for some reason. Don't get me wrong, you'll get some decent food here, but this is not high on my list of places to come back to.

ALways take my kids here. They enjoy playing the games on the tablet while waiting for their food. Service is good. Drinks are great. I havent really had any problems with food. Once in a while someone messes up but who doesnt

Every few months we go to Chili's and I get a half rack of ribs.  Today we made the mistake of going at 4:30pm on a Saturday.  We got seated after a 15 minute wait.  There were 3 tables of 4 near us that all ordered around the same time we did, 2 of them AFTER we ordered.  They all got their food around the same time, but they had to wait quite a while.  After they were all finished eating, and we had STILL not received any food but my asparagus side order, they explained that it was because my husband ordered a TURKEY BURGER.  What was also strange was that they brought my asparagus side order out immediately and it was cold.  We asked them to reheat it and they brought it right back, COLD, and it was the same plate, since we had tasted it, we could tell that, which is fine.  But salty and COLD again. After another 20 minutes, they came and said they would take off the $1 charge to get the premium side order!  And we could have dessert.  But we don't eat dessert.  But they could not comp us for anything else, e.g. the ridiculously expensive 9 oz and 6 oz wine ($18 plus tax and tip, and there was no way the 9 oz glass was 50% more than the 6 oz, they looked almost identical, very shy pours both of them, I'm an engineer and I'm a little OCD). Eventually the food came out.  My husband said no onions, and wanted mustard and mayo with his turkey burger.  Well he got onions but no mustard or mayo!!!  I am not kidding!  Yikes.  My half rack was cold and dried out.  I asked for extra sauce to take home, but they just brought me a little container to put the sauce I still had in!  And then the box was too small for the leftover ribs and the waiter yelled at me and said I asked for a SMALL BOX.  What I had asked for was a box, and a small container of sauce.  I had already figured out that the ribs would not fit in a small container.  We had tried to be really good sports all this time, under these circumstances, and had not even really complained except about the cold asparagus. I rarely leave less than 15%, usually 20-25%% (it's a lot to work in a restaurant) and we eat out at least 2x a day.  But when she snapped at me about asking for a larger container and wasn't willing to give me the container of bbq sauce, I did something I have not done in years.  I left no tip.  The bill was over $40 for a turkey burger, half a rack, and 2 very small glasses of wine.  I realize most of this was not her fault.  But we had not yelled at her or anything.  So her little comment about "you asked for a small box", maybe she did misunderstand, but again, we eat at several places who claim we are the nicest customers they have! Ironically, it was mobbed with people willing to eat here as we left.  That is okay with us, hopefully the places we want to eat at will be less crowded.  We will not be going there again.

The staff was great and the place was clean.  My problem is with the baby back ribs barbecue sauce. The regular sauce was bad.  Buy some KC Masterpiece sauce and dump the junk your using.  My son had the beer Barbecue sauce, and it was better than just the regular one that I had.   I usually go to the Chili's in Cypress and they are great.

Everytime I come to this place I am remidned why I hate coming here. The food is always flavorless and mediocre. I don't leave my house and pay money to eat disgusting food. I had the chciken nachos and they were cold and soggy. The only thing good about this placr is the customer service. I will definitely not come back!

My main issue is with the cleanliness, or lack thereof.  We were seated in a booth with a meridian dividing us from the next room. Hadn't been to Chili's in quite awhile.  The food was tasty, portions ample, and the service decent.  What was objectionable to me was the tables were small, and what little space was there was packed with a table lamp, an ad, a payment terminal and condiments.  There was barely room for our two plates of food.  Also, like in many restaurants today, you don't get a spoon to eat with.  Had to drink my soupy baked beans from the cup. As I looked in the pantry to see what to prepare, the munchkin yelled out dont go there! I turned to her in a jiffy and queried what wanteth thou? She thus proclaimed, I want to go out to eat DAD! So we piled in the truck after checking for coupons in my email and charged off to the nearest Chili's a few miles away.  We hopped out and cruised in pulled by a tractor beam in our tummies... and we had what seemed like a million toys in tow, the munchkin had to have her my little pony, key bracelet, phone, and clifford the big red dog stuffed animal (luckily in miniture).  So onto the grub... we used our coupon for free queso and chips (they included fresh salsa too!!!), the munchkin got a corn dog and steamed broccoli with lots of ranch (somedays I wonder if she really is my daughter, then I take a look at her and know, but such odd eating habits...), and I got the classic, one of my all time favorites, Chicken Fried Steak!!! with mashers swimming in country gravy. I did a water and the munchkin for a super duper tasty slushie concoction that I want to try with about a 2:1 slushie to vodka  mixture!!! Ohhh that would be uber dangerously tasty drink. So we got our grub and the munchkin strictly wants to eat her broccoli with ranch and I practically had to force her to eat a couple of bites of her corn dog. Meanwhile I dug into my CFS, mashers, corn on the cob, and shared the garlic toast with my daughter... The grub tasted was tasty overall (except the bread had some char on the bottom)... However the portions were half what they used to be... Perhaps this is due to the economy or just how Americans are trying to cut down their portion size...  Definitely an enjoyable trip for the munchkin and I! I will be back, I have another gift card to spend :)

I live really close to this Chilis and I would frequently come here about 5 times a month or so with friends and family. They're food is great , I have to be honest !
