Twice I had the same server and he seemed more interested in other customers than us , the second time I was literally about to walk out !! Even though he hardly paid any attention it seemed to be he kept forgetting not only out drink refills but what other people had asked for . After we had these two horrible experiences we decided to just go back again , because why not ? The food is till decent right ? Well .. Our regret !! Different server , but the service was still noo good !! I literally sat there and ate with an empty drink the entire time , til' the very end the server brought me my refill . After all this I have not gone to chilis , and I doubt I ever will . Note to chillis hire people who actually care about their jobs !!  If I can give This chillis less than one star I so would .

1/26/15 Dinner hour. KEEP AWAY FROM THIS ESTABLISHMENT GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. WILL CONTACT BOARD OF HEALTH. I'm not one to write reviews, but  I hope this helps. Get new help and new management. I have never experienced such bad service and food. Service was slow, waiter never brought appetizers we ordered, finally showed up with dinner, didn't  even realized he never served appetizers. ordered baby back ribs came with sliced potatoes in a skillet, they were half cooked had this terrible flavor that was unrecognizable and didn't taste like food at all. requested the loaded mash potatoes and we never got them until everyone was finished with there food. Ordered steak med well it came cold well done and tasteless. Asked for refill on drinks didn't get those until meal was finished. Asked for manager very apologetic young lady appeared she took off steak. whole meal was wrong. i don't usually write reviews but something is terribly wrong here. I will never return.

I came to this location because I was visiting friends in the area. It looked pretty dead but we had to wait. I would've just gone into the bar but my friends have a baby so it wasn't fitting. We got sat eventually and our server came to greet us. The food wasn't all that. My steak was all fat and chewy. Our watermelon juice was way too sweet. The service was slow. Overall just okay. I'm sure it can be better.
The service was good , however the food was gross . The beef was chewy , fatty ,tough , and as if it had  been microwaved first . No seasoning very poor taste . I'm not returning here .
Mediocre Service. homegirls at the bar f&?$in it up. Slow. If you come don't sit at the bar. Loud guests.

This place is extremely packed on the weekends, but the fusion with people and noise (if you're into that) is definitely a good place to go. They have the 2 for $20 menu, which includes steak to burgers to fajitas. For this price, it's definitely better than cooking at home. It comes with appetizers.  The service is usually good (depends from server to server). Overall, they are really nice and friendly. It's a good hangout place with friends during sports play day.

This place sealed the deal!! Zero stars for this dump if I could. On a Wednesday night not even that busy had to wait 25 min to be seated upon warning from hostess that they were short staffed. Waitress walked right by us several times over 15 min then my husband gave up and got us our own drinks in the bar and brought them to our table.  The waitress in our section served 6 tables and didn't bat an eyelash our way.  Meanwhile 30min 2 starving Kids and a husband later we finished our self served drinks and bounced! Only when we were on our way out did we get the attention of our so called server and hostess who were surprised we would be leaving?! Really?! Upon leaving I had the manager Colette called out to 'let her know' that management should be picking up the slack here it's not the paying customers fault you are shorthanded.  Not to mention I would be blogging, social networking and bbb blasting this dumpy service and location.  She stared at me with eyes glazed over and all she could say was sorry for your experience with a blank stare. Sorry Chili's not sorry we are headed to In n out where we should've gone in the first place!!!!!!

25 minutes to get a beer? The service didn't get any better. At least the food was decent and beer well how could you mess that up. This is the second Chilly's I have been to in the last couple of months with the same poor service. Must be a problem with corporate.

Not sure what happened to chilis, but the food was below average. Don't order any Mexican style dishes here. Can't even get a quesadilla right. Burgers aren't any better. Mushy onion rings and overly salted everything. No thanks. Only reason we came was to use up our gift cards. Disappointing.

I was never a fan of Chili's but only went there for their margarita chicken & tequila lime shrimp. I never had any problems with the place, food was good, service was great, never had any complaints. One day we went to the Chili's in West Covina, I ordered my usual and we waited a Lil longer than usual for our meal but didn't complain. When our food arrived it was super cold to the point I couldn't even enjoy it! I was disgusted and vowed to NEVER return to a Chili's restaurant again!.... Tonight I thought I'd give Chili's another shot and not let the West Covina location ruin it for me, so I tried the Chili's in Monrovia, ordered my usual, again wait was a Lil long! Our food arrived and what do you know......MY FOOD WAS COLD!.....AGAIN!!! How could the same thing happen to me at TWO different locations??? Not only was my food cold, but my bf's food was cold as well. I spoke to the manager and she took our food off of the bill. We only paid for our drinks. Needless to say I was dissatisfied AGAIN and I can PROMISE I will never give my business to ANY CHILI'S RESTAURANT!!!!

Ummm nothing is worse than walking into a resturant after a long day and being told there is a 15-20 min and there is a load of open DIRTY tables that can seat people. We finally get seated at a table that had been open the whole time we have been waiting. And to boot they give my kids a kids coloring menu that has already been used. Horrible.

A little disappointing. Yesterday my bf brought me to Chili's for the first time, and we did the 2 for $20 deal. We got the Onion Strings and Jalopeno Stack for the Appetizer, an Original Bacon Burger, and the Cajun Chicken Pasta. Everything was SO salty, especially the Onion Strings and Jalopeno. I do not recommend that for the appetizer. Everything would have been really good if it had half the salt. It didn't bother me that much, but there were crying babies everywhere! I'll probably give Chili's another chance sometime in the future.

I grew up eating at Chili's. I grew up in Texas where there is one in just about every town. With that being said, this place is clean and up to par.  The food is average and consistent. As for the service, it's very inconsistent. We usually sit in the bar area because we have found that the service is a little better. Especially, if you get the gentleman with the short dark hair and beard. Sorry, I can't remember his name. Every one else is so-so.  I will be back...and probably soon.

Went here for my father in laws birthday, his choice .  My wife and I did a dinner for 2 for $20. its like getting a free appetizer. Even though it was crazy small appetizer it was enough to not get over filled on before our dinner came.  We got the texas cheese fries and they are good. The best was peeling the cheese off the bottom of the cast iron. I ordered the half rack of memphis dry rub ribs and i remember the first time i ever had these and loved the rub.  I  was on vacation this last week and we ate out a lot and Sam our server was the best we had at any restuarant. extra star for her.

The server was pretty nice and the wait time was non-existent for a Tuesday night.  Waiting for the food was something else as the triple dipper took a long time to come.  The server apologized for the incident but no idea why it took so long. For the triple dipper, we ordered the Southwestern Egg Rolls (tasted okay but high in sodium), Boneless Buffalo Wings (nuked in the microwave), and Spinach and Artichoke Dip (not bad). For my meal I got the guiltless chicken burger with the vegetables on wheat buns.  The buns were a bit dry.  The rest of the burger itself was okay.  And the veggies tasted like veggies. This place gets 3 stars because of the long wait time for the food and the average tasting burger.
What ever happened to the Chills that we used to frequent, because it has turned into a foul smelling cafeteria style food place. 'Doubt if we'll ever return, but our waiter was good!

So I haven't been here in a long time and as usual everything on the me he looks good our server was very nice and the service wasn't horrible the two stars is because I have kids and I always order a specific way so they get their food first and then I don't have to wait for them to finish at the end. So I ordered their food and an appetizer and waited to order my dinner for another 5 minutes then I ordered my main corse along with my girlfriends 5 minutes later my girlfriends burger came out then the appetizer then the kids food and last but not least my burrito. After all that the food wasn't good at all will never come back

My server was in a different planet. She seemed to be more keen in chatting with other servers. Most times, she was missing from her station and when she walk passed my table, she did not notice that my cuppa coffee need a refill. She had to be asked numerous times. Maybe it was ten at night on a Saturday and the restaurant was near empty. She also did not even bother to check with us on how we were doing (like in most American restaurants). The other server was paying much gracious attention to his tables. My bad luck. Or this is a punishment for deciding on the much promoted $20 Dinner for Two. $20 Dinner for Two is not that big a deal. Half rack ribs (Six inches and you call that Full Size Entrees?) and Fried Shrimp (Six pieces and, again  that's a  full size entrees?)  with limpy fries. That's it for my Saturday late dinner at a non Asian restaurant. I would have to stick to my favourite Asian noodles and fare .

What a disappointment! Took a bite into my jalapeño cheese bacon burger and I felt like I was chewing on little pieces of coals! Opened up my burger to take out the overcooked bacon and it just crumbled on me. I asked the waiter for some new bacon and he was nice enough to bring it to me. It was still a little dry.. Not as bad as the first batch, but C'MON! HOW DO YOU MESS UP ON BACON?! Never again will I order a burger at Chili's.. Never again.
The last few times we came our server was Joe (tall, skinny with glasses) he is amazing, one of the best servers we have come across. Chilis is definitely winning with him as an employee.

The food is good, just the waiters are crappy.  Came in today to see the SA vs MIA, knowing that the restaurant would be packed, which it was. Came in halfway through the 1st quarter, didn't get seated until the half. People who watch basketball know how long that is. When walking into the restaurant, was half heartily greeted by a waitress who didn't even smile. She didn't smile ONCE during the whole time there. Once seated, our hostess was a bit more enjoyable and professional, but even then she took long to take our orders. Left with a mild headache, because I was really hungry when I walked in, expecting some nice customer service, but to no avail.  Maybe because it was during a basketball game the hosts were tired, but it is no excuse to keep people waiting that long.  Making the drive all the way to West Covina next time I want some Chilis.
Please avoid Chili's Monrovia. Terrible service and food. Would not recommend or visit this location again!

Went in late, about 9:00pm 06/08/14 for some drinks and dessert.  Got waited on by Adam in the bar area. I noticed the extensive margarita menu and quizzed Adam about the different ingredients etc. I learned fast that Adam really knew his stuff being a ex-bartender myself. Great service, great drinks and dessert !! I will definitely be stopping in again soon !!

I recently went here with my son who pretty much only eats chicken strips.  They have two things on the menu here that are similar.  One is called "Chicken Crispers" and one is "Crispy Chicken Crispers".  They have different batter/breading.  We talked it over with the waitress to make sure we got the one he's had in the past that was the more breaded type.  When the order came out, it was the other one that is more like a a deep fry batter.  In any case, it was not what he wanted and what we tried to describe.   The waitress made no apologies, but asked if we wanted to order the other one.  We did.  And in the end she charged us for BOTH.  I was very annoyed, when we solicited her help to get the right one when both items with similar names are easy to confuse. Still, not impressed.

Had a party of 16 - 15 orders came within a reasonable time, but the 16th order came very late ( the manager apologized and didn't charge my group for that late arriving dinner ) . The food was ok - no bad / not great. I recommend you try the Coronita (cheers) . Overall the the experience was 3 Stars.

I came here with my family after graduation ceremony. We had to wait a couple minutes to get seated. Once we did, our server was great and made sure we had everything we needed. The food was okay. It tastes like microwaved food, explaining why it came out so fast while they were very busy. I would rate this place a 2/5 but I'm giving it a 3 because the server was great.

OK , seemed like a pretty nice restaurant. Went here for lunch very busy so we had to wait a while to get seated. Once we were seated the waitress took along tome to serve us. But she was very nice and apologetic. Food came and it was pretty good. Not great, not the best i've ever had. I had a burger onion rings and a coke. I should have gotten the name of the burger and taken a picture but i did not. I will google other restaurants before i return. Their not on a bam list with me but i thonk i can find better.

Upon arrival, no greeter @ the front. Waited 5 mins until waiter notice there was line waiting. The bar area is a little messy, knowing that Happy Hour boneless chicken wings are popular, the waitress said they sold out!!! Really!? WOW!!! Anyhow, my lady and I ate real quick and left. We had regular chicken wings, soup and salad.

I would give this place a 3.5.  My family ordered the chips and salsa with guacamole for our appetizer and it was delicious, it was enough to feed four people.  I got the grilled chicken sandwich that came with french fries.  I have to say that the meal was pretty filling.  I also like the fact that they have a fewer calories menu that has healthier choices without cutting out all the good stuff.  The service is pretty good but can get a little slow when they have a full house which is understandable.  I also like that they have the to go service so that you don't have to wait to be seated, you can enjoy your meal in the comfort of your home.

Was taking my friend out for her birthday & she picked this place - which is funny cuz in all the years I've known her I always thought she hated Chili's - Guess I mistaken her for someone else's hatred towards Chilis. Got here at 11:10 right before the lunch crowd. Walked in and stood there for like 5 mins before a waiter came out and seated us. No Hostess? It wasnt even busy. Our waiter was cool, as I was checking into FourSquare I unlocked the free chips & salsa and he happily brought that out to us. I went with the Chicken Cajon Pasta - and my friend got the salad. Food came out pretty quick. Man my pasta was crazy salty.  The garlic bread was great. The pasta was almost uneatable - but I know better than to send food back, especially pasta where they can hide the "secret sauce" very well. So I asked the waiter for some water and forced it down....Im sure that ruined my sodium intake for the rest of December.  My food was horrible, our waiter was good, no hostess up front (at least not when we got there). 2 Stars.

As a restaurant, our family loves Chili's. Today; however, i came in for the bar. I was on my way home, knew the family would not be there so I stopped to see what they had for Happy Hour. Wwhhewwww, sit down: YOU GET $1.00 off Bud Light. NOT even their domestic beers; just Bud Light.  And further more, it bugs me that they don't put the prices of drinks on the menu. Are you embarrassed? You should be. This is not a fancy French Restaurant where the waiter can turn his nose when you ask about prices. This is Chili's, that's why the name of your establishment has "... Bar & Grill" at the end of it. Put the prices on and we can move on. I could have gone to Hooters for what I paid here and well, you know. The bill said I received chicken wings but these were the smallest wings I have ever seen. Come to think of it, there were a lot of pigeons outside. Where can you go in Southern California for a good Happy Hour?

Went on a Monday around 4 p.m & ordered to-go. The hostess was nice but she forgot a lot of important things.... maybe it was an "off" day for her! ;) She forgot to give us utensils and most importantly napkins! yet I asked for some ketchup and she gave me enough to last me a year! hahah. The food was good though so I can't complain too much. Adam is my all time favorite server though! Rad guy!

The staff here is ridiculous, plenty of empty seats on a wednesday night and they made me wait when there was clearly plenty of spots open and clean. Staff is rude and unprofessional. Never going back to this location again.

We got there with a party of 6 including 3 elderly women and a baby. They told us 25 minutes, it was 50. While I walked to the bathroom, I saw two tables that could have accommodated us but for some reason just sat there empty and uncleared. Management just kept telling us with a smile that we'd be seated soon. They were wrong. When the table they were waiting for finally left, the empty-behind-the eyes hostess slowly cleared the table while staring off somewhere in the distance. Why they didn't have a bus-person handy for this, who the hell knows. We were finally seated, there was no apology or maybe, I dunno, free chips for the hassle. Eventually I had to leave cause the baby was losing her shit, but my party continued to wait an abnormally long amount of time for their food and was still offered no apologies or comps. Poorly managed and never going back. Too bad cause I kind of like the food.

This Chili's inexplicably and unforgivably warms its flour tortillas in a microwave!   I was surprised our server admitted this openly and freely...and Dude was Mexican! When I sent them back and asked they be placed over the grill, I punctuated my request with ..."come-on dawg, you know what's up." I was pleasantly surprised by the Texas Fries thing (name escapes me, potentially a problem) and by the Lemon CIlantro dish.  Rice was nice.  Beans were clean. On the other hand, the mini bites were a problem.  And they brought out the fried onion strings 5 minutes after the main plate.  Sent them back and while the dish was removed from our bill they didn't offer me the option of ordering something else.  Wack.

Ordered the 2 for $20 deal. Chicken fajitas were mediocre. they did not come with rice and beans unless you paid a dollar extra. The appetizers left a lot to be desired. We ended up ordering the chicken chipotle half  flatbread pizza and it was not that good. My husband ordered the baby back ribs and fries and he did not like them. I don't think we're going to be visiting Chili's anytime soon.
Chili's always good for comfort food. Southwestern egg rolls very tasty appetizers. Ribs both Memphis dry rub and the spicy chipotle sauce recommended. Top it off with molten chocolate cake.

Eeehhh disappointed fajitas sucked not at all like the photo in the menu. The chips eehh cold. Fresh guacamole not fresh at all it was some what brwn. Ohh and the rice was hard and cold aye vey. :( and i usually love Chilis so sad.

Is it just me or does everyone have one friend that whenever you see this person, they always want to eat at the same place and order the same thing.  Well for me, I met up with this person for dinner to night and the spot she LOVES to eat is Chili's.  I usually give 3 stars to chain restaurants and if service is exceptional then I usually bump up, but on this occasion the service was kinda 1/2 and 1/2 because at the restaurant area, the service was great but at the bar area, the service was boooooty! Let me start off with the food experience in the restaurant area.  We ordered the triple play appetizer with chicken crispers, southwest egg rolls and boneless buffalo wings and the entree was the baby back ribs (full rack) and steamed broccoli and fries on the side all to share.  This was enough food and the food at chain restaurants is usually the same quality for me so thats' why I start at 3 stars and move up or down from there.   The service was good because our server was very nice and even when we left to go to the bar area, she asked why we were leaving her area.  We told her we didn't wanna take up her booth cuz we were going to start drinking after dinner, so she understood. At the bar area, the service went downhill from there.  So when you go to the bar and you don't see a lot of people, you would expect the service to be fast and friendly but this was not the case.  The service was OK but definitely not fast.  At one point I ordered a bottle of beer and it took I would say about 10 minutes and it didn't help that I was thirsty ...... so I was thinking, how long does it take to order a beer and bring it back, especially if it's just a bottle and not draft.  Oh well, so when we were ready to go, my friend says "maybe we should ask for the check already because we don't know how long it will take."  When you're thinking that, you know it's a bad sign. So Chili's in Monrovia .... you are below the bar for chain restaurants for me.
The 20.00 meals for two are pretty good, I miss the awesome blossom.  We don't go here often but the sandwiches, steaks, fajitas are pretty yummy.

After a two year absence decided to use a Xmas gift card here. What a mistake! My ribs were dry and overcooked and the grilled shrimp I ordered may as well have been boiled. My husbands steak was supposed to be medium but it was well done. Everything was so salty too. Blech. I should have saved my gift card for maggianos.

The Good: Outstanding service. Really. Every single person we encountered in the half hour we spent there was a great person who tried their damnedest to do their best by us. We ended up tipping more than we ever would, just because they were so great. The Bad: It's Tex-Mex for the Midwest. Referring to it as Tex-Mex suggests that any of the owners have ever been to either Texas or Mexico. Apparently, they read about them in a book. By Disney. In England. Everything we had was extremely...meh. My husband ordered a burger, which he said was hardly worth the 3200 mg of sodium they managed to pack into it. I tried a couple of their fries, and they were too salty for me to deal with. I ordered their Express Lunch (soup, salad, and chips/salsa). The salad was about what I expected - crappy iceberg lettuce, chopped tomatoes and cucumber, some red onion, a couple of shreds of cheese, and too-hard croutons. I got "balsamic" dressing, which turned out to be this balsamic-citrus emulsion that wasn't palatable. The waitress brought me oil and red wine vinegar instead, so whatever. That was fine. But then there was the soup... In Ireland, any given soup is mixed with cream and pureed into oblivion. I survived a year there solid in my belief that no one would ever, ever inflict this upon me when I returned to California. For the nearly five years since I returned, I've been more or less supported in those beliefs. Until today when I ordered their "Sweet Corn Soup" for lunch and was rewarded with this mess of cream and pureed sickeningly sweet corn. I would actually be shocked to find that they didn't add HCFS to the soup, it was that sweet. So yeah. I understand that corporate food is normally bad, but this was a whole magical level of mediocrity. The only thing this place has right is apparently their hiring policies. The manager saw I had only eaten a fraction of my soup and took the price of it off of my bill, so again, great service.
Good food , large portions. You get what you pay for. This area attracts a lower class clientele with no etiquette. I recommend that they move north.

oh GOODNESS, get me OUT OF HERE!  The food was disgusting. You know those fake acrylic dishes restaurants make to showcase their food and to show you what your ordering? Chili's food tasted like they ripped their display out and served it to us. Gross. The cheese dip was excruciating hot and burned me still after trying to cool it down. LAME. The meat was chewy and tasted like rubber. The vegetables were super oily and the only thing I could consider food was the fajita tortilla which was probably store bought.  Chili'sssssss I WANT MY TASTE BUDS BACKKKK!  DONE.

If I could give zero stars for customer service, I would. Our first point of contact was a spacey hostess who quickly wrote us off once we indicated that we'd like to sit in the bar. Then in the bar we waited for several minutes before our server arrived. She appeared to be having a bad day, so we tried to make nice, but she was not interested in pleasantries. She would "check on us" with an annoyed - almost angry - look on her face. At one point she said, "You're gonna have to give me a minute!" Nice. She must have skipped work the day she was supposed to receive customer service training. Fast forward to when we asked for our check... We showed her the free appetizer promotion we received. She said she couldn't honor it during happy hour. I asked to speak with the manager who then repeated the same thing. (That's funny because we were in recently and our server had no problem honoring a similar promotion. Too bad that server wasn't working today - she was nice.) Basically our server and the manager refused to budge over an appetizer that's only worth a few bucks. Well, they lost a couple of customers as a result of their overall poor service, bad attitudes, and refusal to be reasonable.   The food was a little salty, but not bad for happy hour prices, hence the 2-star review. But the crappy service was a deal breaker.
Two words, FOOD POISONING!  Never again! Yelpers, listen to the reviews and go else where!

Bad service,bad food ,bad experience.Fish had a lot of bones,they overcharged a few things on the menu,Waiter tried to memorize our order without writing but he messed up.l will never go back there again

This place is laughable if you want good food. Nothing but a corporate operation serving the masses. I didn't even finish my cheeseburger it was over cooked and dry. I did sit the whole time in disbelief that this place was so crowded. I was wondering if people in general had no taste in their mouth to want to come here? Or do they just eat what's put in front of them? Anyway it's all good and you won't see me here again.
Great place to celebrate a birthday had lots of fun, service was a little slow but we did have ten people and a little bit of a busy restaurant
Decent grub. Nice bartender. Drinks are a little bit higher than being reasonable but not too painful.

1. Has to ask the waiter to bring the chips.  2. Food is below average. 3. I gave $100 for a $47+ bill, change came back $47+, which was incorrect.  When I told the waiter the change is incorrect, he immediately took out his own wallet and pulled out the exact change that should have been given to me.  He said something like he gave me the wrong part.  Looks like he purposely tried to short change me by $5. To me this is unacceptable excuse.
I had the mix in match fajitas and it was delicious! Everyone else in group also loved their dishes, but what made it more enjoyable was our service! Reina was awesome :)
Love their $6,7,8 lunch menu!  You get a starter and meal (excluding beverage).  With tax and tip, it's about $10.  It's a good deal compare to a burrito from next door.
LURV this place! Chili's is a great restaurant. The kids menu has a variety of food. The normal menu consists of reasonable prices and deliciousness. They even have this game thingy. Cool BD

I used to like coming to eat here but not anymore the last several times i have been coming here the service is the horrible. They greet us and say they will sit us in 5 minutes and take 15 minutes. There was alot of tables that were empty and it was not crowded. Then they finally sit us down and give us the menu we had just sat down and asked if we were ready to order we need to see the menu first were not sure what they have, so they give us like 20 minutes to pick our food that is way too long they didn't even bother to check in on us to see if we were ready to order. So then the girl finally comes back. After a while our food is brought back to us. After we finish eating we keep looking around for the girl who was serving us, then i see her just standing around gossiping with another co-worker i wave at her to let her know we are ready for our check. She takes a while to put it in the system. After she brought us the check then disappeard again for like 10 minutes. We just left what we owed with the bill on the  table. Alot of the staff is just gossiping and standing around. Maybe thats why "they were so busy...with each other". The supervisor was probably not in for the day.
The Sante Fe Chicken salad is absolutely DELICIOUS, and at 700 calories a pretty decent dinner out for dieters!

Chili's is a general mediocre chain restaurant.  It does seem like a fun place because it can get pretty crowded.  A nice option is to sit in the bar, since they have open seating at the bar tables.  If you are a sports fan, it can be a nice leisure meal watching a game.  The prices are what you would expect (generally $10 - 15). I don't particularly like the parking at this particular location.  They have limited parking in the front and around the side and plenty of parking in the back.  The service here tends to be a bit slow.  Other than that, it's pretty much the same as the other chili's locations.

The husband and I went on a Thursday night, it was packed to the door.  They got slammed with a table of 14 right at the start of the dinner rush, and the kitchen was backed up etc.  We were told about a 15 minute wait, not too bad, and it really ended up being about 10 minutes.  There was a group of 5 waiting next to us, and the hostess came around telling them for groups that big it'll probably end up being another 30-35 minutes... she gave them some crackers and the kids a drink each..and even with all the chaos, they ended up being seated about 5 minutes after us.  They were really trying to make things as easy as possible for all of us waiting.   We never went a moment with an empty glass, and were checked in on frequently, but not so often they're crossing the line into bothering.  All the servers were hauling ass to get things done not only quick, but correctly, and it showed.  Our guy, and the surrounding servers were all very pleasant and friendly, not too rush-rush that you feel like you're just another number and tip in the wait.   My usual favorite is the Honey Chipotle chicken crispers, oh man how I love those things... but tonight I was in the mood for fajitas.  I opted for the dual chicken/pork carnitas option, and added the new rice and beans to it.  The pork carnitas were very tasty.  The chicken was good, but no seasoning on it...it still tasted good, like chicken, but I was expecting some fajita seasoning on it at least.  Once I put the toppings on it all was better.   They were just fajitas, how can you really go wrong with that right?  I hate when the cooks get lazy and the peppers and onions come out almost raw, or they go over board and it is all getting mushy.  All the veggies tonight were absolutely perfect.  Firm, yet cooked, and the onions were sooo yummy and caramelized perfectly!   My husband tried a newer option to the menu, the steak with grilled avocado.  It comes with a fancier salad option (vs. the standard garden salad), and some roasted little tomatoes with garlic.  Some kind of green sauce on the steak, with a few slices of grilled avocado.  He had the steak cooked to medium, and OMG, it was amazingly good.  Nice and hot pink center, perfect crust on the outside, sealed all the juices in, and was so tender like butter.  The veggies were delish too!   They have a new appetizer--fried pickles!  And their pickles are house made.  I'm originally from the south, where fried pickles are much more common than out here, I was in heaven while eating this app!  They mix fresh garlic in with them too.   Also love their chips with salsa and regular guac.  One of our favorites to start with.  Their salsa isn't spicy, but it has a very nice fresh tomato taste that is so refreshing.   The only thing that I didn't like was the new stupid tablet order things they put on all the tables now.  It flashes options to pay for games, credit card offers, and supposedly you can use it to order drinks/dessert etc, and if you're paying by card you can pay there using it without your server..  It was annoying and in the way.  You're supposed to go out to eat--to EAT... not to add yet another electronic distraction.  If you have to pay for games to keep yourself or your kids in line while eating, maybe you shouldn't be eating out in public, lol.

This place really doesn't get the credit ir deserves. I've never left this place unsatisfied. The chips and salsa go surprisingly well with every single item on the menu. I split the $20 three course meal for two with a friend, added four dollars to make my steak a ten ounce, and couldn't have left the restaurant any happier. Fourteen dollars for a ten pincer, killer mashed potatoes and some chips and salsa? Forget about it!

Wow, I've grown up at this Chili's yet I haven't probably been there in about a year or so, but this place has gone down hill big time!  The service itself was excellent, Hilary our server did a great job and was very attentive which I find rare in chain restaurants these days.  But the food, oh my it was GROSS!!! I ordered chicken fajitas, and they didn't even look properly cooked. It didn't even look like real chicken meat. They were the most tasteless fajitas ever, I actually had to salt/pepper and use the watered down Tabasco sauce they offered me to make it taste like something, anything! I can't be certain but I think the stomachache I got later that night had something to do with the fajitas, just sayin'. The bf had the Baby Back Ribs in two different sauces, and he said it was just okay, but that he has had way better, and he won't bother ordering them again there. This coming from a man who rarely EVER complains about food!!!  The prices didn't seem appropriate to the portion sizes or overall flavor of the meal. The fajitas were $12.99 with no sides, as sides cost .99 extra. The lack of cheese, tomatoes and tortillas is also irritating. The cheese wasn't even enough for one fajita!!!  It's really frustrating to go someplace you have come to trust and be let down by poor quality food. I'm not sure if I'll be going back anytime soon.

How the heck did I become the duke of Chili's? Seriously, with five check-ins? Is no one else on Yelp going here? Crap - now I'm obliged to write a review.  So here's the thing. On any given day this review could be one star and it could be much as four stars --- o.k., o.k. you're right ---- as much as three stars.  Sometimes, I will have a waitress (never a waiter - weird) that is totally on top of things. Taking our orders. Making jokes. Being generally cool. Other times, I get the waitress from that "Office Space" only she doesn't look as good as Jennifer Aniston. You know. The one who could care less that she is there. The one who is praying to be fired. If only some customers with balls would step up and complain loud enough - but no one does.  At least the food is a consistent greasy mess that is available at "happy hour" prices fairly late. I particularly like some of the burgers... So, I give 2 stars because in general its "meh", but sometimes its "bleh". (Translation "Sometimes Chili's deserves 3 stars, but more often than not service does not live up to expectations, thus a 2 star rating). ... ...Oh well, at least it's not Applebees. With negative 5 stars, still the lowest on my list of crappy chains...

Man I am so sad this Yelp page has so many bad reviews. I am a local that comes here once every few months. I have always received the best of service and the food here is SO good. Their happy hour deals are a steal. Despite all their new menu items, I still get their awesome Chicken Crispers!! They're awesome. Anyway I really felt compelled to balance the bad reviews with the 5-star rating they deserve!! If any Chili's workers are reading this I think you guys are doing a great job!!!

To learn why I will never, ever again frequent this restaurant or any other Chli's Grill & Bar, you may want to read the blog entry that I just posted. It sums up the experience very well. You may laugh a bit as well.

Me and family were having lunch here on the 12/22/2012 lunch time. We had the worst service ever. We ordered ice water with lemon, but never got our lemons. We asked 3 times but we never got it, ever! Our water is always empty and he Never bother to ask or refill our glasses! My daughter never got her chocolate milk till half way on her meal! When we asked a to-go box , he placed the to-go box on top of the plate that has food on them! Really??? No managers were around, i mean what kind of restaurant does this. My servers name was Matt S . I will never eat here again. And i will tell my friends and family as well and make sure they dont eat here !Disappointing!!!!!

I absolutely love this Chili's location. Never once have I received bad service. All the servers are so friendly, especially this one server. I don't know her name but she has tats on her arm. She is wonderful! Whenever I visit here, I make sure I have a coupon to redeem a free appetizer or dessert...it makes my meal that much better!

The service here is generally pretty good. We've eaten here serveral times and a few times we actually had a great server who struck up a conversation and was very friendly and didn't mind putting the Dodgers game on for us. There is one host who is super nice and always smiles and jokes around with customers. The food is regular Chili's fare -- the baby back ribs are tasty and the lunch specials are a good deal if you want something quick. From what I've seen, you'll usually have a good experience here.

We have eaten at dozens of Chili's everywhere. The service in the bar of Monrovia Chili's is usually pretty good, but on one visit, one of the waiters was so rude! From the second he walked over to our table he was rude. My family & I seriously couldn't even believe it because we usually get good service @ this same restaurant. I wish i remembered the guys name so i could warn people to avoid him. Every time he came to the table was like we were inconveniencing him. Buddy, that's your job! I don't care if someone else made your day crappy, you don't take it out on other customers.  My family & I have eaten there since, but thank god this guy was not our server. If he was, we probably would've gone somewhere else or asked for another server.

Rude experience with manager Alicia. Not coming back here again. She came to our table for a minor complaint...no big deal. After that encounter we lost our appetite...we took our food to go. Dissatisfied.

Every time on TV you see a Chili's ad and it shows that you're supposed to have a great time when you're here. The past two times that I came here it wasn't the same. I came here last week and it took 10 min before we were seated. There was no one in the restaurant at 10:30PM and there wasn't even a host! The other waiters walked by us, glanced in our direction and kept going. Finally we were seated and our waiter didn't show up for another five minutes! Luckily our food was good so that made up for the long wait. The waiter assigned to our section didn't even end up taking our order! They had to call someone else from the other section to cover for this waiter. Another thing that irked us is that in the booth next to us was folding napkins and counting her tip money. We were in the middle part of the row and we weren't even at the end!  There are tons of options to choose from their menu. Get their bottomless Chips and Salsa. It's cheap and it's great to share with other people. The sandwiches, burgers and main entrees are awesome! You can also mix and match with the Baby Back Ribs.  I'd rate this higher but until they get their service issues straightened out, I won't rate it higher than a 3. I'm not saying all Chili's are this bad but this one bites the dust. I don't think I'm going back for a while. I'll go to another Chili's.

I tried their 2 for $20 deal and surprisingly, it was better than Applebee's! Somehow I think the portions were bigger and dishes were more flavorful. Also, this place seemed more Asian (?) because all dishes I ordered came with green onions. I thought green onions are nonexistent in American restaurants. Oh my. I actually enjoyed grilled chicken pasta with green onions on it..

Happy Hour isn't the greatest, but its okay. Okay discounts on drinks and some appetizers.  But the bar is small so good luck getting a seat at the bar. We do always seem to find one empty table that is waiting for us, but we prefer sitting at the bar.  Maybe one day we will be lucky enough to find two empty spots.  I have never tried the steak or fish here, but the appetizers have never disappointed. Nothing out of the ordinary either. The basic nachos, onion blossom, wings, etc. All okay. I have tried some chicken and sandwich entrees, and again, nothing awesome, but good. Lunch and dinner menus are pretty limited.  I would go here for drinks and snacks. I would not go here for good food.
It's Chili's.  Dont come here very often, but food and service were good.  It's been a while....looks like they changed the chicken crispers.  Still good tho

I normally don't write reviews for super-chain/Sh*t-on-the-walls restaurants but going here twice, and having bad experiences has compelled me to warn you all. The first time my friends and I went here, my friend found a piece of cardboard in his food...and couldn't finish the rest. The waiter came over and asked if he'd like a new plate of food, my friend declined. He just wanted the meal taken off the check. So the manager came over and tried to convince him to get another meal, ANY meal... again, my friend politely declined, and once again asked for the meal to be taken off the bill. The manager got all hissy and pissy and said "Fine" and walked away. That previous experience was about 5 months ago... Well, last weekend, my friends and I decided to try again. I ordered the Quesadilla Explosion salad. The concept sounded amazing... but of course, the delivery was half-assed.  The quesadillas were hard as rocks (to joke, i tapped it on the table. yes it was THAT cold and stale)... it tasted as if it was sitting, for at least a half hour, in a refrigerator. And one quesadilla had guacamole all over it (there was no guac in my salad)... so, to refresh: cold, hard, stale quesadillas that had been rubbed up against other food. With me so far? My friend ordered the chips and salsa... these arrived clear. Clear? What could she possibly mean by that?? Only that there was SO MUCH oil, it made the chips clear (transparent, see-through, however you want it put.) I'm not at all surprised by the lacking quality of food that is served here. What I am surprised at, is the weird phenomenon of people that keep coming back. Yikes..
Cajun shrimp Alfredo pasta, delicious! & club quesadilla w/ black bean Patty instead of chicken, very good also. Good service (Kim)!

If I could give less stars I would. We got the unlucky chance of getting Bethany k as a server. She was the rudest waitress I have ever had. It's very disappointing I have never been treated so bad. She slammed our food down on the table and walked away. I could hear her talking to other tables she much nicer to them. I don't know what we did that was such a problem because we sat down and the rudeness started. We were even able to say anything before it started so there was no attitude or anything from us it was terrible . She did not talk to us. Refused to be nice, and would not get items asked for. We waited longer then everyone else that came after Us For food. She didn't ask us how our meal was didn't even say thank you for coming in. what a shame that chilis hires waitresses that clearly don't want to be there and can not to do their jobs . I wouldnt recommend anyone thinking of coming here to avoid it. Coming in was terrible too they made us wait when there was plenty of open tables. I understand if we have to wait but no need to be extremely rude about it. I will not ever come back to this place it is terrible. Bethany's attitude was the worst for a waitress I have ever seen . Terrible service , terrible food.  Avoid at all costs .

Not sure why the hell I even came here!  I don't like eating at Franchise Restaurants. I would rather support the independently owned family restaurants that struggle everyday in a horrible economy to make your meal memorable.  Oh yeah now I remember why I came here. I was with my brother in law, sister in law, nephew, and the wife. The relatives LOVE to support the big chain restaurants and would never dare step out of there comfort zone and try a new exciting restaurant. So I got out voted as to where we eat.  What a shame~  Nothing was memorable about my experience. We came for lunch. Ate off the lunch menu. I got the Half smoked Turkey sandwich with a cup of Baked Potato soup. The dish came with fries. There was a lot of food on my plate for $7.89. The bread for my sandwich tasted a little old and the soup was to salty. Wife got the beef sliders with a side of soup. Her dish was over $10.00 and unimpressive as well. Meat was dry and over seasoned.  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~America~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The way to your heart is threw your stomach.  Big Plate of Food~  Bad for you~  Tasteless~  Salty~  $30.00 dollars worth.  No thanx  Cheers~

Me and my wife  went for dinner last night and we we're really disappointed it was our first time and our last time coming to chili's i rather go to sizzlers and get the same food actually better food .The server was OK i guess the main issue the food.Wont ever waste my money here again.

We usually come here for the ribs which is consistently pretty good except for a few times there were barely much meat on our order.  The rest of the menu is average and sometimes the food can be bland or overly salty or spicy.

I don't usually go to Chili's and I would usually give it three stars for being average, but this night..I give it 4 stars.  I had a hankering for their black bean burger with sauteed mushrooms, paired with a corn on the cob and some fried strings.  Being cold without a jacket two days ago, coming into Chili's for some hearty meal with hot water and lemon, the game on the screen, and a very warm, welcoming, and delightful server named Adam...well I was having a darn good time.  I was comfortable, happy, full, and I think a lot of was because Adam was such a great server.  Thanks Adam for making a great Chili's experience because unfortunately without adam, I would give it a three for food quality.

We eat here a lot.  This is one of the places my young son likes best!  I think there's some sort of inverse relationship between how much the adults like a restaurant v. how much the under 10 crowd likes a restaurant.   Having said that, he likes the cheese pizza here and at Acapulco's (go figure, right) the best.  He doesn't like the pizza at the Cheesecake Factory and the Langham as much, maybe because the tomato sauce is more than the typical tomato sauce, which he prefers.   I usually get the quesadilla explosion salad.  It has grilled chicken, with lettuce, cheese, corn, tortilla sauce, all served with a balsamic vinaigrette.  And it's served with quesadillas.  I like it, even though it has a million calories or so in it.   My husband usually gets the grilled chicken sandwich, guiltless style.  He really likes that.  And then he usually splurges on a paradise pie, which is a brownie, with a scoop of ice cream, caramel, and chocolate sauce on top.   To me, their ribs are just okay, kinda dry, not enough sauce.  And their fajitas are really disappointing, and that's for someone who doesn't have the most seasoned Mexican food palette.  Compared to Acapulco's fajitas, which I think are actually pretty good, the fajitas at Chili's are not very authentic.

On a weekday afternoon, this place is all but dead. It certainly makes one wonder when the area is crawling with restaurants that have at least a handful of customers at any given time. I've never eaten here, and probably never will. I went for an interview and management told me something that was a down right lie. Not only that, but he had to go into this long, complex and completely unnecessary way of skirting the truth. If a manager cannot be honest with a potential candidate, what would make one think that he is honest with customers.

Came here to have a lunch meeting and it was a good experience overall. The food is chain food, don't expect it to be scrumptious. But it was okay and the environment was okay. It was just ab bit loud, but part of it is the bar area patrons themselves. We got a good waiter and he was on top of things but not overly so. The bathroom was a mess, dirty and sloppy. This is an ideal location...in the middle of the shopping area just off of Huntington Drive. The freeway is mere minutes away and so it was good to meet up with people coming from different places.
It was good,  nothing special though and everyone brags about the baby back ribs, but I've had way better.
Love Chili's. This is a good restaurant. Came in for lunch and ordered the soup and half sandwich, YUM. Very good service.

Sloooow service. Sat for 10 minutes before we were greeted, 40 before our food arrived. Watched two other parties get sat, only to get up and leave because nobody came to get their drink orders. Only pro was quick and easy bill pay with electronic swipers on the table.

I have been going to this Chili's since the dinosaurs roamed the earth...lol well not that long but pretty long now and it has never been this bad.  Now i want to start by saying that our waiter was great and pretty fast on bringing out our food.  Now for the food...yuck times 10. We ordered the triple dipper appetizer to share (which BTW came out same time as our food..) with the spinach artichoke dip, chicken crisper's and big mouth bites. Well aside from everything being cold it was not worth the $10.99 price. The spinach artichoke dip was cold and not very good. the chicken crisper's cold as well, the big mouth bites were only 2 and not amazing at all. Now for my chicken Caesar salad...ummm can you say regular iceberg lettuce and microwaved chicken? Really Chilis? You are going to charge me close to $10.00 for iceberg lettuce and some rubbery microwave chicken?  Well sorry but after this experience its doubtful i will be returning to Chilis ever again...it just joined the list of "no thanks, I'd rather starve" restaurants.

I was planning on meeting friends for lunch here tomorrow, but to my dismay I read they took the paradise pie off the menu. Tragic!!!!!! That was the best thing they had going and the only reason I picked Chili's. And so I guess we will be GOING to BJ's!!!

Okay, so alot of people say this place is reasonably descent..  I disagree!!  Every time I've been to La Salsa, Chipotle, Baja Fresh, or Sharkey's; the F'in burrito's were like $8 bux, without a drink, chips; or adding avocado..  I think the fast food, (wanna be Health chains), are way overpriced!!  At Chili's, you can sit down, order a larger than average size burger, salad, pasta, or steak plate; that all comes with a waiter, a drink, at a sit down venue for like $10 bux.. What a concept!!  A true sit down, full serviced meal, for like $10 bux a person.. LUNCH or DINER!! Come on in, sit down; and try your luck..  By the Way, they are open till like midnight daily; they have a full bar with flat screens.. $10 BUCKS (in my opinion, this leaves alot of other in the dust.. ALL FAST FOOD CHAINS, DENNY'S, COCO'S, SHAKERS, JERRY'S DELI, EL TOR ITO, ACAPULCO'S, (THE LAST TWO MENTIONED IS MORE LIKE EL CRAP-OLA); and any other place that you find yourself scrambling for dollar bills; not chump change). i.e..  The last few time I went to Carl's Jr.. 1 (one) meal with soda & fries; Like $9 dollars!!!  I was like, "does this come with a car wash or WHAT"???

This is the WORST service I have ever had in my life.  We waited 45 minutes for a salad and fajitas and finally had to cancel our order.  Not one person, including the manager, apologized or asked what they could do to make out experience any better.  I understand places get busy, but by the time we put a cancel on our food, only 3 tables in the area we were occupied.  A couple came in 10 minutes after we ordered and had gotten their appetizer and entree.  I will never eat here again.

I've never eaten at a Chili's before last night. If you like heavy foods and sauces - you're probably already down with Chili's. I am not, & there was really nothing appealing to me outside their drink menu and a "side" caesar salad (which was actually regular-sized if you ask me). My boyfriend on the other hand, was stoked on the ribs, corn, and beans. Other than that, the service was all-smiles (if you don't count the hostess who seemed distracted, her gaze was far-away).

I haven't dined here for quite awhile because of a bad experience last time, but decided to give them another try yesterday. At the hostess stand, there was an elderly couple ahead of me and my husband. 1st, the young host tried to push them into sitting in the bar area. When they resisted, he reluctantly seated them on the west side of the restaurant. as they requested. He then wanted to sit us on the opposite side. We informed him we preferred to sit on the west side, also, where there were several tables available. Because of recent construction (ugly view out windows)  and a cramped, narrow, noisy area on the east side, I don't like sitting there. He informed us that because the last several parties had been seated on the west side, we HAD to sit in the east section. I said "ok" and turned to leave. He apologized and made no attempt to get us to reconsider. I wonder if his supervisor would be happily if they knew he was allowing customers (and their money!) to go walking out the door to spend their money elsewhere?

I don't know what made me say Chili's"s when my mom asked me where do you feel like going to eat....Oh I remember I thought "Hey they have that two for $20 deal", and since I wanted to save my mom some $$$, let's go check it out. so we arrive and it's a 45min wait or quickly be seated at the bar with a bunch of football fans and oddly single drunk girls, speaking way too loud about what there F*cked up friends did to them and why are they still see the same A$$holes, My mom could not stop staring at these two girls, she even mentioned I hoped they don't get served anymore corona's. I was we will be out of here by then mom. So my sister and mom got the 2 for $20.00 deal and I wanted to try the trio fajita deal. Okay I was not please by any of the food, mines ( which got me sick that night) nor by the "specials".. it's all chicken.. that's all you get to choose from Chicken! My sister didn't even eat her meal, my mom was full from the chips and salsa and soup and took her meal to go and when it came to pay the waitress gave us the bill but no debit card in return. I will say this the service is good, but the food is blahhh!

Don't bother with Chilis. In the world of Chilis, this particular restauarant seems to consistently disappoint. I used to come here for lunch with coworkers, and the food was always made poorly, came late, or there would be a problem with the bill. Recently I went here with my wife to use a gift card, and literally every table around us was upset and asking to speak to the manager. The waitress apologized ahead of time and warned that the food would be slow etc... I appreciate the staff here for trying hard, but this is not a place worth spending any money at. 2 stars for servers who take care of you in spite of bad food and horrible atmosphere.

Although a chain, I have to admit I love Chili's. Chicken crispers are my guilty pleasure, but I pretend it's healthy because it comes with corn. Albeit corn slathered in butter, but corn nonetheless.

Chili's, as we all know, is a pretty good "a-okay" restaurant.  However, I'm a cancer patient and back on my original chemo, meaning my taste-buds are shot to hell.  Anything that USED to taste good normally ends up resembling large chunks of metal in my mouth - regardless of the consistency (which then causes lots of wonderful vomiting sessions throughout the day).   Going to different Chili's in the past, I know it's an okay place.  I love me some ribs and nachos sometimes anyway.  And I read the reviews repeating themselves OVER and OVER and OVER again about the calories a place like this has.  First off, ALL restaurants overblow calories in dishes which could be much, much lighter if you made them at home.  However, I ain't complaining because when you weigh 95 pounds in a hospital, something tells me some poeple NEED those extra calories, so leave it be!  Meanwhile, the Chicken Enchilada Tortilla Soup is the only thing I've been able to finish off of a plate in front of me in WEEKS without throwing up.  So one thing I can say is, Thank God For Chili's!!!  And cancer patient's, move this restaurant to the top of your post-chemo list!!!
Every time I come I am seated quickly even on rush days, I get my servers right away and my food it served always hot...I recommend the bar seating when you don't have a large Party!

So most people reading this are aware (and if they're not be advised) Chili's is a chain restaurant.  I am grading it based on other chain restaurants in the same general price category (Applebee's, TGI Fridays, etc.).  This would not be the place to go if you are looking for truly authentic Tex-Mex fare.  That being said, for a chain restaurant, Chili's makes some tasty food.  As a former suburban midwesterner, Chili's always reminds me a little of home.  The food is comparatively inexpensive and consistently good.   I'm actually a little surprised at the other reviews here-- I've been many times, and I've always found the service at this Chili's location to be above average.  Maybe I always get lucky, but I can't remember a time at this restaurant where I didn't have a server that was quick to deliver refills and check to make sure everything was okay.  It is true-- this location is usually on a pretty long wait on the weekends.  I'm not sure that this can be held against the restaurant-- after all, it just means people want to eat there.   As far as food goes, I always start with the chips and salsa.  Again, there is nothing terribly authentic about the salsa, but it is a little spicy and a lot addictive.  I think that Chili's does burgers, sandwiches, and salads best.  The Cajun Chicken Sandwich is particularly tasty. So maybe it's lowbrow of me to admit it, but I like Chili's.  And I like the Monrovia location.  As far as chain restaurants go, you could do a lot worse.

Two for $20 - two entrees and one appetizer for $20.  Not a bad deal.  Even though their deal used to include dessert!  But still, a good deal. Got their Santa Fe Chicken wrap for a "lighter" meal, even though it's still 660 calories!  It's your standard chicken wrap. My fiance and mom got the Margarita grilled chicken with black beans and tortilla chips and salsa.  It's also one of the lighter items on the menu and looks delicious! The BBQ ribs look good, a little bit dry, but the bbq sauce helps.  My brother got the chicken fajitas and he said it's a little too salty.  My past experiences with Chili's has been that they put a lot of sodium in their dishes!  If you're watching your sodium, I say don't eat at Chili's. Service at this location was good.  Our waiter was very friendly and nice.
Yeah yeah.. I know it's a chain... But i just love this place.. Everything I get is good. And their presidente margarita beats out some of the fanciest mexican joints i've been to...

Yea.... so I'm not too big on this TEX/MEx stuff and it's never been too appealing to me.... and still isn't. There's nothing too enticing about this place.  I guess it's good to go to for get-togethers for co-workers but nothing else.  There's not much to pine for here.  The Awesome blossom is pretty good but that's about it. Go to Denny's....That's what I was thinking the whole time....at least I would had had the options for Moon over my Hammies....

I went to this Chili's on Dec 24th, and I got food poisoning the following day, best christmas ever.  I ordered a burger, medium well ( it came out VERY well done ).  After throwing up 10 times and having diarrhea for 2 days I was fine.  I went to the restaurant and complained and the manager was very helpful in refunding my burger, not that I got to really eat it anyways.   I suggest you don't eat burgers from places that don't have good ground-beef.  This article pretty much sums it up:   .  I checked online about in-n-out, and apparently they have much better quality control measures.  I've been there 100's of times w/o gettingsick.

My favorite Cheese Quesadilla is located right here (and I've tried many). It's not on the menu but since I'm a veg I ask for cheese only... and the good thing is that they charge less (about $6.29)! Not all restaurants do that so 4.5 stars for them. Plus, it's pretty huge. For $1.29 you get guacamole. The wait is always a long time... about 30-40mins when I go? So this place must be good. Good thing there are other places to go while we wait since this Chili's is located at a big plaza in Monrovia. Also located next to many other good restaurants so that we can change our mind about which restaurant to eat at. ;)

I was very skeptical to go to this Chili's especially since all the reviews posted were bad.   Fortunately, I found no problem parking in the front.  The service was great and our waiter,  Adam, was very helpful.  He made sure the food came hot and the beverages were topped all the time.   The food we ordered was not particularly healthy but if you intend on eating healthy, your choices are limited to the salads or vegeterian menu.     For the prices of restaurants these days, you are getting a great deal for their 2 for $20 dinners and I had a free coupon for the chips and queso .   If you expect top notch quality food good for the heart and body at a restaurant like Chili's then you will have a problem.  If you just want to eat some comfort food, then this is the place.
Great Restaurent chain, this location poor.
Very busy but very good. I love the chicken ranch sandwich but have them leave off the wing sauce! Also the nachos are pathetic. They say they're loaded but you literally only get 6 chips.

Looking forward to some ribs... Informed they were out of ribs. This is at 4:30pm on a Sunday. Dissapointed and ordered medium well steak. Steak arrived...or should I say beef jerky arrived. Charbroiled exterior.. super dry white interior. 5 minutes after receiving our order, next table received their RIBS. WTF! Spoke to manager. She apologized, but had no explanation. Discounted our food 50%. Not good enough! Our experience sucked. Called corporate. Said they'd get back to me. Still waiting.....

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing (Baby Back Ribs with the original Chili's Sauce) but the food was disgusting.  The ribs were very dry, and had no meat whatsoever on them.  The mashed potatoes tasted bland and the french fries as a side tasted sandy and felt grainy on the tongue.  YUCK. Service was really slow.  I was sitting in the back, next to the restroom area, and was surprised to see that a couple servers would go to the back area quite often just to chat with each other and gossip.  It kind of pissed me off to have to wait 10 minutes to get a refill of water while all those waiters were just standing around talking to each other.

I have always enjoy Chili's, more than any other similar type of restaurants. The best food, service and price, except not enough locations! They top TGIF, Islands, Apple Bees, Red Robin! They're unique, good ambience, even when it's busy, the wait time is faster than any other restauarnts. I wish they have loyal customers program for free meals.

The first Chili's I ever went to was in Doha, Qatar.    That one was good, this one was better.   The food has been very good, the service has been usually okay, though a bit slow. However, don't bother on evenings and weekends.   The wait is horrible!

This place should be minus 200 stars, lets face it closure of this joint would be well deserved.  Was there 9/5/2013 at 11:45 am for lunch with my 92 year old dad.  We never could get our water refilled which was all we were drinking.  Shame on you people for not doing refills for it was 103 degrees that day, and yes we asked 3 different people several times each.  My flat bread pizza came so over cooked it was so dark brown it was almost black & you could not see the toppings.  The waiter said it was how they served them and I said no for I go to the one in Rancho Cucamonga  where is where I live all the time -- never seen one that color.  The manager came out 25 minutes later when dad was done with his lunch with my now correct pizza.  Oh, and did I say after ordering it took over 45 minutes to get our one sandwich and burnt pizza.  Pass on this Monrovia and also the Montclair Chili's, it is worth the drive to Rancho Cucamonga for that manager and staff has there act together.  Wish someone from Chili's corporate office would read these reviews and do something about it before all their chain goes under.  As you can see, I am not the only one who is complaining.

I am not a fan of Chili's but was given a gift card and we thought that we'd use it to get a couple of drinks.  We first wanted to sit at a table but there were only two open and both were absolutely filthy! We then took at seat at the bar. The bartender was friendly. We both ordered mojitos which tasted like straight sweet and sour. We then decided to order two of their top of the line margaritas the same thing! I am not a drinker and usually two drinks would affect me, but nothing! I think that they decided that they could just skip the alcohol! DON'T BOTHER!

Went to Chili's with my sister, brother in law, 2 nieces, and a friend. Don't really think much of this chain. It seems very junior high school but with a 4 and 8 year old in tow, what other options did we have. Rather loud with the music and there are a lot of staff aimlessly hanging about the hostess area/entrance. They seated us at a cramped table where we were basically ignored by our server. She probably was applying more eye shadow. She was trying to be Kat Von D. She really did not want to help anyone. The table next to us had "issues" with her. She was slow with drink refills, did not want to give any napkins from her sacred trove of paper-goods  Food was rather average. Throwing Jalapenos on a bacon cheeseburger does not make it something to cheer about. The Texas fries were good, but for the money they charge, you would think that the portions would be bigger. We shared it as a group and I got maybe 8 french fries each. The kids meal was a total joke. It was Kraft Mac N' Cheese out of the box. Why go to a restaurant when I could have made it at home. Not thrilled and simply wanted to leave. Paid the bill and that was that. For the money we paid, around $75.00 for 3 adults and 2 kids for lunch, save your money and go somewhere else. It really is no big thrill. .

Let me start by saying that I have a strange soft spot for Chili's in general. I am not normally a chain restaurant kinda gal, but I like Chili's.  Okay, that being said... We went to watch the NBA playoffs, as did many other people. Three tv's were on the game, two others (prominent ones) were on a baseball game. We asked if they could be changed, server said no, bartender didn't want to. Witnessed four other groups ask for the channel to be changed, denied. People were craning to see the game, no one other than the bartender was watching the other tv's. The group next to us was friends with the bartender, and she came over to visit with them after the game was over, and we overheard her gloating about how she wasn't changing the tv's just because people asked her to...umm...it's been a while since I worked in a restaurant/bar, but I'm pretty sure that the customers' vote should override one employee's desire.  Service sucked. Won't be back.

This is a combination of two-visits: Their service is obnoxiously slow and inattentive.  Doesn't it drive you nuts when the server tries to memorize your entire order (i.e. doesn't write anything down) and then of course, he makes several mistakes? The hostess who seated us promised to come back and wipe down our table which was wet, but she never came back. Our server never checked on us after we placed our order (which took about 30 mins of waiting to do).  We had to flag him down repeatedly to get drink refills, fix the numerous mistakes on our order, get utensils, etc.  What was he doing instead?  No, not busy checkin on other tables...but instead chatting it up in plain sight of our table with other servers. The only thing that prevents me from giving this place 1-star, is their food which is tasty when prepared correctly, and their manager Susie who is amazing.  I don't know how she deals with a whole bunch of unmotivated teen/college-age employees, but she is professional, courteous, honest, and gracious. After waiting an hour for our food, and finding out that they ran out of french fries, she apologized profusely and gave us our dinner for free (at least the portion that we actually got from the kitchen). She turned an unpleasant experience into a memorable one.

Ok we all know about Chili's they do have great food.. But one big reasone why me and my family keep goin back to the Monrovia Location, is because we love the people there..  Great Service.. all the time..  Food is served timely.. We always bring our kids.. We all enjoy our time there,, We visit Chili's Monrovia several times a year

I'm sorry but I have to agree that this place sucks on service. I have tried coming here time after time since friends love eating at Chili's but this time was  unbelievable. To start off there was no customers but for some reason the service was still very bad. I was waiting at a table with a friend and we waited for 10 minutes for some waitress to come and actually tell us that she will be right back . Another 5 minutes goes by and she then comes back and says she will take our order after she gets back. We weren't happy and said to her that we need to order right now. So we put the order, very simple it was just a simple burger and also ribs. Alrighty well it took us around 30 minutes to get anything no drink or no food....It is sad but I've always known this chili's or many other Chili places to have very bad service. I don't understand why it took so long she didn't have people to wait on and she still took her damn time....Food was fine but the wait for it is not worth it. I don't think they even try to give you good service.

I used to work here years ago(in Ohio) so I know how things work.  I got a pickup order and it was ready within 5 minutes.  The food tasted really good but the portions were lacking.  This was Friday at 7pm so the restaurant was very busy.  I would have rather gone and sat down to eat but the wait was 40 minutes.  I would go back and probably will this week as I have a soft spot for their Margaritas.  They are quite tasty.

I've never been much of a Chili's fan. Well, actually the only thing I've really ever enjoyed is the mushroom burger. But it would be nice to try something different for a change. And boy was that  a bad idea. Practically everything else is deep fried. Eww.

Oh my goodness! All I can say is food poisoning! My brother and cousin both got food poisoning from eating the beef there. Luckily, I had a salad with no meat. They were throwing up for 24 hours. Oh man! And, everything was  a mess. The dishware was dirty. I had to send my water glass back twice because there were food particles in the water. Ewww. Plus the food there just tastes old. The company was very nice though and refunded our meal, and provided us with cash vouchers to Chili's again! Why again? We got food poisoning the first time. Why would we go back?!

The many times I have gone to Chili's, I have had bad expriences or good expriences.  I have done so many customer service surveys for them and I truly think they do not take them in consideration.  They are never at level of effiency. It takes forever to get a drink from the bar. The triple decker app is 10 bucks, but only 3 of each food item. That is not a saving.  They are trying to be healthy, but there food it still high in Calories.  Food portions have gone down a lot, but we still pay a high price.
Chili's has the best margartita I have ever had!  Be sure to order the EL NINO...fantastic drink...believe me, they don't scrimp on the alcohol!

Last time we went, my daughter had to use the restroom. When we came back, our table was all amiss. Some of my food was in her plate. Our napkins and silverware had been replaced and everythign was moved around. Apparently, they had bussed our table, realized the mistake and tried to put everything back without telling us. I stop eating because who knows what they did with our food. I asked the waitress about it & she didn't even apologize or ask if everything was ok. And yes, it takes at least 3 requests to get your drink refilled.

How many times do you think it takes to ask for and receive a drink refill? Well at our latest venture to this Chili's the answer was 3. The first time the waiter, Jeff, noticed on his own. Good Boy Jeff! 15 minutes later when he brought our food, but not our drinks, we asked him for a refill. After another 15 minutes in which we witnessed him taking orders and bringing drinks to other customers, he happened to look over the side of the booth and noticed that we still did not have our drinks. FINALLY, 5 minutes after that we got our refills. This isn't rocket science people! All we wanted was 2 waters and a soda, nothing complicated, probably something that was in a pitcher around the corner from our booth. He never even acknowledged that it had taken him over 30 minutes and 3 requests to fulfill our request. No apology, nothing. Now I've been to this Chili's many times. The food is usually good, but the service is so inconsistent that I'm seriously doubting I'll go there again if I have my choice.
